themes: positive impact of recent funding reforms
disparity between White-led and BIPOC-led organizations
role of marginalized communities in Austin's cultural identity
key_phrases: astounding for marginalized and lesser represented arts groups
efforts to equalize funding was breathtaking
left behind in funding for DECADES
over $30M has been given to White led, White serving arts organizations just since 2010 as compared to $5 for Latinos
my own organization, impacted by the deficit in equitable funding, just got a development director in 2019 for the first time in nearly 20 years
Latinitas and it has been able to meet capacity needs because the city took the time to acknowledge groups like ours
over 40,000 girls and teens in Latinitas have experienced filmmaking, writing, podcasting, graphic and web design and other STEAM activities
Black and Latino community being the center of Austin's coolness, even still while it gets more gentrified
barriers_identified: lack of development staff due to funding deficits
White-led organizations having more resources and development capacity
solutions_proposed: continue the campaign that was started to equalize funding
city's economic development should maintain focus on equitable support
